description: Structural works to the internal slab, pilings, foundations, South East buttress, and external walls; the like-for-like repair and/or replacement of the damaged Northern bay lead light window; and the in situ repair of the remaining East Chapel windows.
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.Reason: This is required by Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 (as amended).

The works to which this consent relates shall be carried out in accordance with the Schedule of Works reference AC/IDI/22724~Schedule Rev3 (dated December 2023). Any departure from this Schedule of Works shall be agreed in writing by the local planning authority prior to the relevant works being carried out.Reason: In order to safeguard the significance of the listed building, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to the commencement of the relevant works, specifications and detailed drawings of the proposed new windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved specification/drawings.Reason: In order to safeguard the significance of the listing building, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Prior to commencement of the development to which this permission relates (including any works of demolition), a photographic record of the existing window to be replaced once boarding is removed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The works shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development to safeguard any heritage assets present on the site.

All work involving the removal of the existing historic fabric associated with the development hereby approved must be carried out with hand tools only. If this cannot be achieved, the method of removal shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement. The works shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent harm to the significance of designated heritage assets, in accordance with policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM12 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development to safeguard any heritage assets present on the site.

With the exception of the floor slab and finish, all new works and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile. Reason: In order to ensure the special architectural and historic interests of the listed building are safeguarded in compliance with paragraphs 212 to 221 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2024, policy HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy CS8 and Policy DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012.
